children.content:
Full-stack developer with expertise in web development, game development, and system design.
Passionate about building tools that solve real problems and make developers' lives easier.

This was where I first discovered the magic of making computers do what I wanted them to do.
The visual programming blocks made complex concepts accessible to a young mind.

A complex dungeon-crawler experience built entirely within Minecraft using custom plugins.
This project taught me the fundamentals of Java programming and server-side development.

While I suffered from "shiny object syndrome" and left many projects unfinished, each
attempt taught me valuable programming patterns and improved my code quality.

My father, already working in the tech field, provided invaluable guidance and support
throughout my programming journey.

Working without frameworks taught me to appreciate the fundamentals and understand
what modern frameworks provide under the hood.

resolvedRefs.title:
Full-stack developer with expertise in web development, game development, and system design.
Passionate about building tools that solve real problems and make developers' lives easier.

children.content:
After rewriting my Minecraft dungeon-crawler server & plugins twice, I had grown quite
comfortable with the Java eco-system, and I set out to make my first large-scale project
(library). While fooling around with Game Development, I grew a keen interest in multiplayer
games, and since all my games were developed with GameMaker, I wanted an easy way to be
able to manage larger-scale multiplayer games.The project was to write a Java Library that would be able to easily interact with GameMaker
clients, and operate as a game server for multiplayer games. This project grew my skillset
very quickly, and I got my first taste of deploying a coding project & the open-source workflow.This was my introduction to open source development, proper documentation,
and building tools for other developers to use.

Looking back on this journey, I'm amazed at how each experience built upon the last.
From the visual blocks of Scratch to professional software development, every step
taught me something valuable about programming, problem-solving, and building things
that matter.
programming-journey
software-development
career-growth
continuous-learning
Time spent documenting and reflecting on this incredible journey

A comprehensive timeline documenting my evolution from a curious 10-year-old discovering
Scratch to becoming a professional software developer. This journey spans over a decade
of learning, building, and growing in the programming world.Early Foundations (2011-2018)My first baby steps into the programming world was with Scratch. This software was
installed on every computer at my school, and one of my friends had stumbled upon it
randomly, and I was instantly obsessed.This was where I first discovered the magic of making computers do what I wanted them to do.
The visual programming blocks made complex concepts accessible to a young mind.From what I had learnt with my experimentation with Scratch, I was fascinated by the world
of game-dev, like a lot of young programmers. During school, a very helpful teacher suggested
that I try out GameMaker:Studio, as our school had secured a handful of licenses for
GameMaker:Studio 1.4, which was pretty new at the time.I was hesitant at first during the transition, it took me a while to get out of the blocky
dialect of Scratch and move to a more text-based scripting language (GameMaker Language).
After about a month I finally switched over, and had fallen in love with the enhanced
capabilities, performance, and workflow of GameMaker.I spent these years creating little games for my friends and myself, finding that
programming was incredibly enjoyable, and even published some of these games online.Throughout my childhood, there was one game I always came back to. I started playing
minecraft early in 2012, and I had tinkered around with minecraft servers, as I hosted
some in order to play with my friends. During this time I found plugins, and I felt like
such a hacker editing the configuration files.It wasn't long until my love for game-dev crossed paths with Minecraft, and I embarked
on a journey to create a dungeon-crawler within Minecraft, using plugins. At first, I was
using all pre-made plugins and attempting to configure them to throw together some experience
to share with others. Eventually, I found needs that couldn't be met with any existing plugins,
so I attempted to create my own.This was my first steps into the world of Java - my first "real" programming language.A complex dungeon-crawler experience built entirely within Minecraft using custom plugins.
This project taught me the fundamentals of Java programming and server-side development.Deepening Skills (2018-2021)After having published a couple of my simple games with GameMaker on itch.io, and one of
them amassing 50,000 plays, I decided to take programming a bit more seriously. I had
purchased GameMaker Studio 2 with the money I had earnt from working at my local McDonald's,
and I set out to create any game that I could think of.Of course, like all motivation-fueled game-devs, I had a serious case of shiny object syndrome.
This meant that throughout my entire time making games, I had only managed to publish onto
itch.io about 5 of them. I had upwards of 30 projects that lay unfinished, however my
programming skills increased with each game, reinforcing and learning new programming patterns
so that each game was slightly better & cleaner than the last.One of my early GameMaker games reached 50,000 plays on itch.io, giving me confidence
to pursue programming more seriously.While I suffered from "shiny object syndrome" and left many projects unfinished, each
attempt taught me valuable programming patterns and improved my code quality.Professional Development (2019-Present)During school and for my first couple years in University, I worked at McDonald's. I
enjoyed the high-pace environment, and the community at McDonald's, I managed to build
life-long friendships with my co-workers. I attained the role of Crew Trainer, and did
some professional development with the McDonald's office to improve my coaching ability,
which went hand-in-hand with my other job after school, Badminton Coach.Advanced to Crew Trainer role with professional development training from McDonald's corporate.I started studying Computer Science in 2021. I've always known - well at least since I
was 10 - that I wanted to be a programmer. My family was always very supportive of my
aspirations (my father especially, as he had already been working in this field for most
of his life).University has helped me to formalise my knowledge, and gain a deeper understanding of
the lower-level and foundations of programming. Before University, I only really felt
confident in a couple languages, the ones that I had spent years working with; but now
I believe I could pick up any new language within a day - and be able to write
professional-level code within a week.My father, already working in the tech field, provided invaluable guidance and support
throughout my programming journey.At the beginning of University, I found the programming courses relatively easy, so I
decided to start thinking about how I could earn some money off programming, as that was
my end goal - to be able to support myself by doing what I love.I did some market research (watching developer influencers on youtube), and decided that
front-end programming was pretty important in the workforce, and that was a sector of
programming that I had never indulged in. I felt confident enough in my backend skills -
due to my experience with Java and the development of my gm-server library, that I decided
the best course of action would be for me to just dip my toes in web-dev.Needless to say, I fell in love with the Web Development world, and it's become my
favourite area of programming.Web development became my primary focus and favorite area of programming, shifting
my career trajectory toward full-stack web development.After my third semester of Uni, and coming out of my first successful tech job, I applied
to many junior positions in my city. I had learnt enough JavaScript & Java that I thought
I could land a part-time job over the semester break, and gain some work experience as well.Eventually, I managed to get a job for a local company, which has pretty large operations
but a relatively small software team. This job required me to learn PHP - a language that
I had never looked at, within 2 weeks. My skills & knowledge were put to the test, but I
managed to pick it up in the 2 weeks from the interview and when I started working, and
within my first week I had already pushed some code to the production servers.It was quite interesting moving from web-dev with React & NextJS to just using vanilla
PHP and JavaScript, no frameworks. This meant we basically had our own hand-rolled
solutions for everything.Learned PHP from scratch in 2 weeks and deployed production code within the first week of employment.Working without frameworks taught me to appreciate the fundamentals and understand
what modern frameworks provide under the hood.Major Projects & MilestonesAfter rewriting my Minecraft dungeon-crawler server & plugins twice, I had grown quite
comfortable with the Java eco-system, and I set out to make my first large-scale project
(library). While fooling around with Game Development, I grew a keen interest in multiplayer
games, and since all my games were developed with GameMaker, I wanted an easy way to be
able to manage larger-scale multiplayer games.The project was to write a Java Library that would be able to easily interact with GameMaker
clients, and operate as a game server for multiplayer games. This project grew my skillset
very quickly, and I got my first taste of deploying a coding project & the open-source workflow.This was my introduction to open source development, proper documentation,
and building tools for other developers to use.Looking back on this journey, I'm amazed at how each experience built upon the last.
From the visual blocks of Scratch to professional software development, every step
taught me something valuable about programming, problem-solving, and building things
that matter.Time spent documenting and reflecting on this incredible journey
Finishing my Bachelor of Computer Science at University of Adelaide
Deepening expertise in modern web development stack including React, TypeScript, and cloud technologies
Contributing more actively to open source projects and building tools for the developer community

The developer I'm working to become - someone who builds meaningful software that
helps people and contributes positively to the tech community.

As of 2024, I'm focused on completing my Computer Science degree while working as a
Software Developer. My current interests include:Finishing my Bachelor of Computer Science at University of AdelaideDeepening expertise in modern web development stack including React, TypeScript, and cloud technologiesContributing more actively to open source projects and building tools for the developer communityThe developer I'm working to become - someone who builds meaningful software that
helps people and contributes positively to the tech community.

Researched various sources for parliamentary data, including official government APIs,
web scraping opportunities, and data availability across different jurisdictions.
Build the core system that processes parliamentary data and generates human-readable reports
Implement email subscription system with personalized report delivery
Create user-friendly web interface for browsing reports and managing subscriptions

This project represents my belief that technology should be used to increase civic
engagement and make democracy more accessible to everyday people.

Exploring how programming and artistic expression can complement and enhance each other.
Many of the same principles that make good code also make good art: composition,
balance, iteration, and attention to detail.
Built a responsive gallery system for showcasing photography work with metadata and tagging
Integrate music player for original compositions and covers

Just like coding, painting is about iteration, learning from mistakes, and gradually
building more complex skills on top of fundamental techniques.

Documenting my painting journey with progress photos, technique notes, and reflections.Just like coding, painting is about iteration, learning from mistakes, and gradually
building more complex skills on top of fundamental techniques.

Studied various multiplayer game architectures, latency compensation techniques,
and anti-cheat systems to inform the design decisions.
Built the game client in GameMaker with smooth movement, responsive controls, and network communication
Implemented authoritative game server in Java with player synchronization and match management
Design and implement skill-based matchmaking for balanced competitive matches

Building multiplayer games presents unique challenges around network synchronization,
latency compensation, and maintaining game state consistency across clients.

Deep dive into GameMaker's networking capabilities, socket implementations, and

Created comprehensive documentation with code examples and getting-started guides
Provide ongoing support to developers using the library and maintain compatibility

This project taught me valuable lessons about API design, documentation, backwards
compatibility, and maintaining open source projects.

positive feedback from the GameMaker community.This project taught me valuable lessons about API design, documentation, backwards
compatibility, and maintaining open source projects.

Researching how developers currently manage projects and tasks, what tools they use,
and where existing solutions fall short of their needs.

props.title: The Case for Minimalistic Development Tools

children.content:
Exploring why developers often prefer simple, focused tools over feature-heavy alternatives.
Sometimes the best tool is the one that gets out of your way and lets you focus on the work.
Narrowed down to core features: project creation, task management, and simple time tracking
Building a clean, distraction-free interface that prioritizes function over form
Integrate with git repositories, development tools, and common developer workflows

The goal is to create a tool so simple and intuitive that it becomes invisible -
helping developers stay organized without adding cognitive overhead.
productivity
developer-tools
minimalism

A hyper-minimalistic project and task management tool designed specifically for developers.
After multiple iterations and redesigns, I'm currently working on a streamlined version
that focuses on simplicity and developer workflow integration.Researching how developers currently manage projects and tasks, what tools they use,
and where existing solutions fall short of their needs.Exploring why developers often prefer simple, focused tools over feature-heavy alternatives.
Sometimes the best tool is the one that gets out of your way and lets you focus on the work.Narrowed down to core features: project creation, task management, and simple time trackingBuilding a clean, distraction-free interface that prioritizes function over formIntegrate with git repositories, development tools, and common developer workflowsThe goal is to create a tool so simple and intuitive that it becomes invisible -
helping developers stay organized without adding cognitive overhead.

props.title: Stack setup for a golang API with bun testing, postgres database, and S3 storage

children.content:
Comprehensive analysis of the Go ecosystem for web APIs, comparing frameworks,
ORMs, testing tools, and deployment strategies to identify optimal combinations.

Documented the reasoning behind each technology choice, including alternatives
considered and trade-offs evaluated

Developed comprehensive testing approach using Bun for fast test execution
and reliable CI/CD integration

Created guidance for taking the development stack to production, including
security considerations and performance optimizations

Full working example with Docker setup, comprehensive tests, and deployment scripts
that developers can use as a starting point for their own projects.

Providing complete, working examples is often more valuable than theoretical
explanations. Developers can learn by running, modifying, and extending real code.
golang
api-development
testing
architecture

I've made an example stack for easy setup using golang, drizzle, minio, and bun for
end-to-end testing. I walkthrough some of the decisions I made and the reasoning
behind them in this post.This comprehensive guide goes beyond just showing how to set up the stack - it explains
the architectural decisions, trade-offs, and reasoning behind each technology choice.Comprehensive analysis of the Go ecosystem for web APIs, comparing frameworks,
ORMs, testing tools, and deployment strategies to identify optimal combinations.Documented the reasoning behind each technology choice, including alternatives
considered and trade-offs evaluatedDeveloped comprehensive testing approach using Bun for fast test execution
and reliable CI/CD integrationCreated guidance for taking the development stack to production, including
security considerations and performance optimizationsFull working example with Docker setup, comprehensive tests, and deployment scripts
that developers can use as a starting point for their own projects.Providing complete, working examples is often more valuable than theoretical
explanations. Developers can learn by running, modifying, and extending real code.

Documented the process of migrating a JavaScript project to TypeScript, including
challenges faced, benefits realized, and lessons learned about type safety.

props.title: From JavaScript to TypeScript: A Developer's Journey

children.content:
Reflecting on the transition from dynamic to static typing, the initial resistance,
the gradual appreciation, and ultimately the realization that TypeScript makes
JavaScript development more enjoyable and productive.
Built initial version in vanilla JavaScript to establish baseline functionality
Systematically migrated codebase to TypeScript, adding type definitions and improving code quality
Compared performance, developer experience, and code maintainability between JS and TS versions

This project solidified my understanding of TypeScript's benefits and gave me practical
experience in migrating existing codebases to adopt type safety.
typescript
code-migration
learning-project

A project specifically designed to explore the transition from JavaScript to TypeScript
and experiment with different approaches to state management and task organization.Documented the process of migrating a JavaScript project to TypeScript, including
challenges faced, benefits realized, and lessons learned about type safety.Reflecting on the transition from dynamic to static typing, the initial resistance,
the gradual appreciation, and ultimately the realization that TypeScript makes
JavaScript development more enjoyable and productive.Built initial version in vanilla JavaScript to establish baseline functionalitySystematically migrated codebase to TypeScript, adding type definitions and improving code qualityCompared performance, developer experience, and code maintainability between JS and TS versionsThis project solidified my understanding of TypeScript's benefits and gave me practical
experience in migrating existing codebases to adopt type safety.

marine life behavior, and equipment protection - similar to debugging complex systems!

Studied effective coaching and teaching methodologies, sports psychology, and
team motivation techniques to become a more effective leader.
Successfully managed and coordinated practice schedules, competitions, and development plans for 8 teams
Created personalized training programs for players at different skill levels and tracked progress
Developed game strategies, analyzed opponent patterns, and prepared teams for high-level competition

The leadership and analytical skills developed in sports coaching directly apply to
software development team leadership and code review processes.
leadership
coaching
team-development
sports

Led coaching for 8 different badminton teams at competitive city level, developing
leadership skills, teaching abilities, and team management experience that directly
translates to software development team dynamics.Studied effective coaching and teaching methodologies, sports psychology, and
team motivation techniques to become a more effective leader.Successfully managed and coordinated practice schedules, competitions, and development plans for 8 teamsCreated personalized training programs for players at different skill levels and tracked progressDeveloped game strategies, analyzed opponent patterns, and prepared teams for high-level competitionLed teams to compete successfully at the highest level in local city competitions,
with several teams achieving top placements.The leadership and analytical skills developed in sports coaching directly apply to
software development team leadership and code review processes.

Looking across this portfolio of projects, several themes emerge that have shaped my
approach to software development and creative work:Iteration and Learning: Nearly every project has gone through multiple versions,
redesigns, or pivots. This isn't failure - it's the natural process of learning and
improving. Each iteration teaches something new about the problem space, user needs,
or technical constraints.Cross-Pollination: Skills learned in one domain consistently apply to others.
Leadership from coaching translates to software team dynamics. Visual composition
from photography improves UI design. Game development networking knowledge applies
to web API design.Community and Open Source: The projects that have had the most impact are those
that solve problems for others, not just myself. Open source contributions and
community resources create value that extends far beyond the initial effort.Balance of Technical and Creative: The most fulfilling projects combine technical
challenges with creative expression or meaningful impact. Pure technical exercises
are valuable for learning, but projects with purpose and personality are what I
remember and continue to develop.

Explore how AI tools can enhance development workflows and create new possibilities
for creative and productivity applications

Develop projects that have positive environmental impact or help others make more
sustainable technology choices

Create resources and tools that help other developers learn and grow, building on
my experience with documentation and teaching

Future projects will prioritize: meaningful impact, technical excellence, community value,
and personal growth. The goal is to build things that matter, not just things that work.

props.title: Serverless NextJS with Drizzle-ORM for Cloudflare

children.content:
Compared different serverless platforms (Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare) and their
trade-offs for Next.js applications, ultimately choosing Cloudflare for its edge
performance and cost efficiency.

Outlined step-by-step tutorial structure covering environment setup, database configuration,
ORM integration, and deployment process

Created complete, tested code examples that readers can follow along with, including
a sample repository with working implementation

Verified the entire deployment process works end-to-end and documented any gotchas
or common issues readers might encounter

This tutorial has helped numerous developers set up modern web applications with
type-safe database operations and edge deployment capabilities.
nextjs
serverless
cloudflare
tutorial

Tutorial for setting up a NextJS app router application with Drizzle ORM for deployment
using cloudflare serverless functions. This comprehensive guide walks through the entire
setup process, from development environment to production deployment.Compared different serverless platforms (Vercel, Netlify, Cloudflare) and their
trade-offs for Next.js applications, ultimately choosing Cloudflare for its edge
performance and cost efficiency.Outlined step-by-step tutorial structure covering environment setup, database configuration,
ORM integration, and deployment processCreated complete, tested code examples that readers can follow along with, including
a sample repository with working implementationVerified the entire deployment process works end-to-end and documented any gotchas
or common issues readers might encounterThis tutorial has helped numerous developers set up modern web applications with
type-safe database operations and edge deployment capabilities.

props.title: Setting up Drizzle-ORM to work with Postgres Container

children.content:
Deep dive into Docker networking, container communication, and common connection
issues between application containers and database containers.

Created minimal reproduction case demonstrating the common connection problems
developers encounter with this setup

Documented the exact configuration changes and troubleshooting steps needed
to resolve the connection issues

Sometimes the most valuable blog posts are simple solutions to specific problems
that developers commonly encounter but struggle to find clear answers for.
docker
postgresql
drizzle-orm
troubleshooting

via docker-compose.yml, I brain dumped my solution for that exact purpose.This post addresses a specific pain point many developers face when setting up local
development environments with containerized databases and ORM migrations.Deep dive into Docker networking, container communication, and common connection
issues between application containers and database containers.Created minimal reproduction case demonstrating the common connection problems
developers encounter with this setupDocumented the exact configuration changes and troubleshooting steps needed
to resolve the connection issuesThis post has saved many developers hours of debugging Docker networking issues
and has been referenced in various developer communities.Sometimes the most valuable blog posts are simple solutions to specific problems
that developers commonly encounter but struggle to find clear answers for.

props.title: Stack setup for a golang API with bun testing, postgres database, and S3 storage

children.content:
Comprehensive analysis of the Go ecosystem for web APIs, comparing frameworks,
ORMs, testing tools, and deployment strategies to identify optimal combinations.

Documented the reasoning behind each technology choice, including alternatives
considered and trade-offs evaluated

Developed comprehensive testing approach using Bun for fast test execution
and reliable CI/CD integration

Created guidance for taking the development stack to production, including
security considerations and performance optimizations

Full working example with Docker setup, comprehensive tests, and deployment scripts
that developers can use as a starting point for their own projects.

Providing complete, working examples is often more valuable than theoretical
explanations. Developers can learn by running, modifying, and extending real code.
golang
api-development
testing
architecture

I've made an example stack for easy setup using golang, drizzle, minio, and bun for
end-to-end testing. I walkthrough some of the decisions I made and the reasoning
behind them in this post.This comprehensive guide goes beyond just showing how to set up the stack - it explains
the architectural decisions, trade-offs, and reasoning behind each technology choice.Comprehensive analysis of the Go ecosystem for web APIs, comparing frameworks,

props.title: How to fix glossy selects in webkit (Safari)

children.content:
Investigated Safari's WebKit rendering engine differences compared to Chromium
and Firefox, specifically focusing on form element styling inconsistencies.

Created visual examples showing the inconsistency between browsers and the
specific appearance issues with Safari's default select styling

Developed and tested CSS solutions that maintain functionality while achieving
consistent appearance across all major browsers

Ensured the solution maintains accessibility standards and doesn't break
keyboard navigation or screen reader compatibility

While it's tempting to ignore Safari given its smaller market share, providing
consistent experiences across all browsers is part of being a professional web developer.
safari
css
cross-browser
webkit

Making sure your application works the same across all the different browser engines
can be a major pain point in web development. This post tackles a specific Safari
styling issue that many developers encounter.Safari's default styling for select elements includes a glossy appearance that can
clash with modern flat design aesthetics and break visual consistency across browsers.Investigated Safari's WebKit rendering engine differences compared to Chromium
and Firefox, specifically focusing on form element styling inconsistencies.Created visual examples showing the inconsistency between browsers and the
specific appearance issues with Safari's default select stylingDeveloped and tested CSS solutions that maintain functionality while achieving
consistent appearance across all major browsersEnsured the solution maintains accessibility standards and doesn't break
keyboard navigation or screen reader compatibilityThis solution has been widely shared in developer communities and helped solve
a common frustration point for web developers dealing with Safari quirks.While it's tempting to ignore Safari given its smaller market share, providing
consistent experiences across all browsers is part of being a professional web developer.

props.title: 5 Things I Would Teach Myself 10 Years Ago

children.content:
Analyzed common patterns in developer career progression, both from personal
experience and by observing other developers' journeys in the community.

Early in my career, I built many projects but rarely shared them publicly.
This was a missed opportunity for feedback, networking, and career advancement.
Building in public and sharing your work is one of the fastest ways to grow
as a developer and connect with the community.

The temptation to jump to new, exciting projects before finishing the current
one is strong, but completing projects teaches crucial skills: dealing with
the "boring" parts, polishing details, and understanding what it really means
to ship software to users.

While it's valuable to be aware of different technologies, constantly switching
frameworks and languages prevents you from developing deep expertise. Pick
a stack and master it before exploring alternatives.

Writing about what you learn reinforces the knowledge and creates a valuable
resource for your future self and other developers. Blog posts, notes, and
tutorials help solidify understanding and build your reputation.

Programming can feel isolating, but the developer community is incredibly
welcoming and helpful. Participating in forums, contributing to open source,
and attending events accelerates learning and creates opportunities.

Some of the most valuable content comes from honest reflection on mistakes
and lessons learned. Vulnerability in sharing struggles helps other developers
feel less alone in their journey.
career-advice
programming-journey
developer-community
reflection

Lessons Show Off Your Work Force Yourself To Finish Stick to one stack Document your...A reflective piece looking back on my programming journey and identifying the key
insights that would have accelerated my growth if I had understood them earlier.
This post resonates with developers at all stages of their careers.Analyzed common patterns in developer career progression, both from personal
experience and by observing other developers' journeys in the community.Early in my career, I built many projects but rarely shared them publicly.
This was a missed opportunity for feedback, networking, and career advancement.

as a developer and connect with the community.The temptation to jump to new, exciting projects before finishing the current

tutorials help solidify understanding and build your reputation.Programming can feel isolating, but the developer community is incredibly
welcoming and helpful. Participating in forums, contributing to open source,
and attending events accelerates learning and creates opportunities.This post gained significant traction in the developer community and sparked
discussions about career development strategies across multiple platforms.Some of the most valuable content comes from honest reflection on mistakes
and lessons learned. Vulnerability in sharing struggles helps other developers
feel less alone in their journey.
Implemented the fundamental features: project creation, task management, and basic time tracking
Planning which parts of the application to open source and how to structure the codebase for community contributions

Regular development updates help maintain accountability and allow the community
to follow along with the design and implementation decisions.

Following on from my last update, the new redesign is coming along nicely, along
with finally implementing some of the core functionality. Future plans to open
source part of the application are described, and a roadmap for initial release
is laid out.Implemented the fundamental features: project creation, task management, and basic time trackingPlanning which parts of the application to open source and how to structure the codebase for community contributionsRegular development updates help maintain accountability and allow the community
to follow along with the design and implementation decisions.

Explored the tension between minimalist design principles and practical usability,
finding the right balance between simplicity and functionality.
Enhanced the interface while maintaining the minimalist aesthetic, focusing on clarity and user experience

Sometimes taking a break from a project provides valuable perspective on its
strengths and weaknesses. Fresh eyes often reveal obvious improvements.

It's been a while since I've worked on devpad, and I've forgotten exactly how
the system is setup. Trying to use this application has brought to life many
limitations of the hyper-minimalist vanilla html feel.Explored the tension between minimalist design principles and practical usability,
finding the right balance between simplicity and functionality.Enhanced the interface while maintaining the minimalist aesthetic, focusing on clarity and user experienceSometimes taking a break from a project provides valuable perspective on its
strengths and weaknesses. Fresh eyes often reveal obvious improvements.

Analyzed the complexity introduced by splitting the application across multiple
servers and evaluated whether the separation was providing real benefits.
Consolidated the application architecture to reduce complexity and eliminate session synchronization issues

Sometimes the simplest solution is the best solution. Premature optimization and
over-engineering can create problems that don't need to exist.

After running into some issues synchronising the session across 2 different servers,
I rethink why I have these servers split up in the first place.Analyzed the complexity introduced by splitting the application across multiple
servers and evaluated whether the separation was providing real benefits.Consolidated the application architecture to reduce complexity and eliminate session synchronization issuesSometimes the simplest solution is the best solution. Premature optimization and
over-engineering can create problems that don't need to exist.

project-documentation
development-log
design-process

Explored modern JavaScript patterns, module systems, and state management
approaches without relying on frameworks or build tools.

Designed a clean, maintainable architecture using only JavaScript language features
and web APIs

Building without frameworks forces you to understand the underlying web platform
and browser APIs, providing valuable insights into what frameworks do for you.

In this log, I'll delve into specific coding challenges and solutions encountered
while developing the todo-tracker in vanilla JavaScript.Explored modern JavaScript patterns, module systems, and state management
approaches without relying on frameworks or build tools.Designed a clean, maintainable architecture using only JavaScript language features
and web APIsBuilding without frameworks forces you to understand the underlying web platform
and browser APIs, providing valuable insights into what frameworks do for you.

Researched best practices for migrating existing JavaScript codebases to TypeScript,
including incremental adoption strategies and tooling setup.

Systematically added type annotations, interfaces, and type safety throughout
the codebase while maintaining functionality

The transition to TypeScript was smoother than expected and provided immediate
benefits in terms of code quality and developer experience.

As part of the todo-tracker project, I transitioned the project from JavaScript
to TypeScript, documenting the process, challenges, and benefits discovered along the way.Researched best practices for migrating existing JavaScript codebases to TypeScript,
including incremental adoption strategies and tooling setup.Systematically added type annotations, interfaces, and type safety throughout
the codebase while maintaining functionalityThe migration caught several potential bugs and made the codebase significantly
more maintainable and self-documenting.The transition to TypeScript was smoother than expected and provided immediate
benefits in terms of code quality and developer experience.

typescript

Analyzed how feature creep and scope expansion had made the project unwieldy
and difficult to complete, leading to the decision to dramatically simplify.

Identified the core 20% of features that would provide 80% of the value
and eliminated everything else from the initial release

Learning to say "no" to features and focus on the essential functionality
is one of the most important skills for completing projects successfully.
project-management
scope-creep
product-development

A while ago I started a large-scale project that I intended to be able to use myself
to manage both my coding projects & university assignments. This post documents the
decision to significantly reduce scope and focus on core functionality.Analyzed how feature creep and scope expansion had made the project unwieldy
and difficult to complete, leading to the decision to dramatically simplify.Identified the core 20% of features that would provide 80% of the value
and eliminated everything else from the initial releaseLearning to say "no" to features and focus on the essential functionality
is one of the most important skills for completing projects successfully.

Exploring the connection between writing and learning, and how the process of
articulating ideas helps solidify understanding and reveal knowledge gaps.

Good documentation should be treated with the same care and attention as code.
It should be clear, maintainable, up-to-date, and provide real value to users.

The most satisfying blog posts are those that solve real problems for other
developers. Seeing comments from people who were helped by a tutorial or
troubleshooting guide is incredibly rewarding.

My approach to technical writing is rooted in the belief that writing about something
is one of the best ways to truly understand it. When you have to explain a concept
clearly to others, you're forced to examine your own understanding and fill in any gaps.Exploring the connection between writing and learning, and how the process of
articulating ideas helps solidify understanding and reveal knowledge gaps.Good documentation should be treated with the same care and attention as code.
It should be clear, maintainable, up-to-date, and provide real value to users.The most satisfying blog posts are those that solve real problems for other
developers. Seeing comments from people who were helped by a tutorial or
troubleshooting guide is incredibly rewarding.

Explore how AI coding assistants are changing the development process and
document best practices for integrating them effectively

Create a comprehensive series on web performance, from measurement to optimization
techniques across different aspects of web applications

Write about maintaining mental health, avoiding burnout, and creating sustainable
practices in a demanding field like software development

Future content will continue to focus on practical solutions to real problems,
combined with honest reflection on the development process and career growth.

and advanced language features that many developers never fully understand.

props.title: The DevOps Handbook
props.author: Gene Kim, Jez Humble, Patrick Debois

children.content:
Comprehensive guide to DevOps principles, practices, and cultural transformation
needed to implement effective DevOps in organizations.
devops
docker
cloud
deployment

Learning modern DevOps practices, containerization, cloud platforms, and
infrastructure as code to build and deploy robust applications.Docker containers, Docker Compose, multi-stage builds, and container orchestration
for development and production environments.Created standardized Docker development environments for multiple technology stacks,
enabling consistent development experience across team members.Experience with AWS, Google Cloud, and Cloudflare for hosting, deployment,
and serverless applications.Comprehensive comparison of serverless vs traditional hosting approaches,
including cost analysis, performance characteristics, and use case suitability.GitHub Actions, automated testing, deployment pipelines, and release management
for reliable software delivery.Successfully implemented automated deployment pipelines that enable frequent,
reliable releases with zero downtime.Comprehensive guide to DevOps principles, practices, and cultural transformation
needed to implement effective DevOps in organizations.

In-depth study of different multiplayer game architectures, latency compensation
techniques, and anti-cheat systems for competitive games.

Game design principles like user feedback loops, progressive disclosure, and
reward systems apply directly to application UX design and user engagement.

Comprehensive exploration of game design principles that apply to both games
and interactive applications. Excellent framework for thinking about user experience.

Technical deep dive into the challenges and solutions for building multiplayer
games, including network architecture and synchronization strategies.
game-development
multiplayer
gamemaker
game-design

Accumulated knowledge from years of game development, from simple 2D games
to complex multiplayer systems and game server architecture.GameMaker Language (GML), game design patterns, sprite management, physics,
and publishing games to multiple platforms.Published games that achieved over 50,000 combined plays across platforms,
demonstrating ability to create engaging player experiences.Java-based game servers, network synchronization, player state management,
and real-time multiplayer systems.In-depth study of different multiplayer game architectures, latency compensation
techniques, and anti-cheat systems for competitive games.Player psychology, game balance, progression systems, and creating engaging
gameplay experiences.Game design principles like user feedback loops, progressive disclosure, and
reward systems apply directly to application UX design and user engagement.Comprehensive exploration of game design principles that apply to both games
and interactive applications. Excellent framework for thinking about user experience.Technical deep dive into the challenges and solutions for building multiplayer
games, including network architecture and synchronization strategies.

Continuous development of soft skills, leadership abilities, and professional
competencies that complement technical expertise.Code review, mentoring junior developers, architectural decision-making,
and leading technical discussions.Mentored multiple junior developers who successfully advanced to mid-level
positions with improved technical skills and confidence.Writing clear documentation, giving technical presentations, and explaining
complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.Collection of technical blog posts, documentation, and tutorials that
demonstrate ability to communicate complex concepts clearly.Agile methodologies, sprint planning, stakeholder communication, and
balancing technical debt with feature development.Study of different agile methodologies, their strengths and weaknesses,
and how to adapt them for different team sizes and project types.Systematic approach to debugging, root cause analysis, and breaking down
complex problems into manageable components.The best debuggers aren't those who fix problems fastest, but those who
understand systems well enough to prevent problems from occurring.Essential principles for becoming a more effective programmer, covering
everything from code organization to career development.Guide to advancing beyond individual contributor roles and taking on
technical leadership responsibilities in engineering organizations.

The most effective way to learn programming concepts is through hands-on
building of real projects. Theoretical knowledge without practical application
quickly fades, while concepts learned through building persist.

Writing about what you learn - whether in blog posts, documentation, or
personal notes - significantly improves retention and understanding.
Teaching others is one of the best ways to learn.

Regularly revisiting concepts and technologies prevents knowledge decay.
Maintaining a learning journal helps identify areas that need reinforcement.

Participating in developer communities, forums, and open source projects
provides exposure to different perspectives and approaches to problem-solving.
learning-methodology
knowledge-retention
continuous-learning

children.content:
Learn Rust or Go for systems-level programming to understand performance
optimization and lower-level system concepts

Understand basic ML concepts and how to integrate AI tools effectively
into development workflows

Deep dive into microservices, event-driven architecture, and distributed
systems design patterns

Explore React Native or Flutter for cross-platform mobile development
to expand application delivery capabilities

Focus on fundamentals that transfer across technologies rather than chasing
every new framework. Deep knowledge in core areas is more valuable than
surface knowledge across many areas.

Learn Rust or Go for systems-level programming to understand performance
optimization and lower-level system conceptsUnderstand basic ML concepts and how to integrate AI tools effectively
into development workflowsDeep dive into microservices, event-driven architecture, and distributed
systems design patternsExplore React Native or Flutter for cross-platform mobile development
to expand application delivery capabilitiesFocus on fundamentals that transfer across technologies rather than chasing
every new framework. Deep knowledge in core areas is more valuable than
surface knowledge across many areas.
learning-resources
skill-development
knowledge-base
continuous-improvement
developer-education
Time spent organizing and documenting learning resources and knowledge base

A curated collection of learning resources, skill development paths, and educational
materials organized around key programming concepts, technologies, and career development.
This knowledge base serves both as personal reference and community resource.Programming FundamentalsCore computer science concepts learned through university coursework and
self-directed study. These fundamentals provide the theoretical foundation
for practical programming work.Arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, graphs, hash tables, and their
applications in solving complex programming problems.Understanding data structures deeply has improved my ability to choose the right
tool for each problem and write more efficient algorithms.Sorting, searching, graph traversal, dynamic programming, and algorithm analysis.
Focus on understanding time and space complexity trade-offs.Consistently able to solve complex algorithmic problems and explain solutions
clearly to other developers.Design patterns, software architecture, testing methodologies, and code quality practices.
Understanding how to build maintainable, scalable software systems.Excellent resource combining theoretical algorithms with practical problem-solving
approaches. The "war stories" provide real-world context for algorithmic thinking.Fundamental principles for writing readable, maintainable code. Has significantly
influenced my coding style and approach to software craftsmanship.Web Development Mastery PathComprehensive skill development in modern web development, from frontend frameworks
to backend systems, DevOps, and performance optimization.Modern HTML5 features, semantic markup, accessibility standards, and web standards compliance.Deep dive into web accessibility guidelines (WCAG), screen reader compatibility,
and inclusive design principles for building truly accessible web applications.CSS Grid, Flexbox, animations, responsive design, CSS-in-JS, and modern styling methodologies.Collection of experimental layouts and design patterns to explore CSS capabilities
and push the boundaries of what's possible with pure CSS.Modern JavaScript (ES6+), asynchronous programming, TypeScript, and advanced language features.Investigation of JavaScript performance optimization techniques, memory management,
and runtime behavior to write more efficient client-side code.Successfully convinced multiple teams to adopt TypeScript, providing training
and migration support to ensure smooth transitions.React, Next.js, state management (Redux, Zustand), testing (Jest, React Testing Library),
and modern React patterns.Comprehensive collection of React patterns, anti-patterns, and best practices
developed through years of React development experience.Node.js, Express, API design, database integration, and server-side architecture.Study of REST, GraphQL, and modern API design principles including versioning,
documentation, rate limiting, and authentication strategies.Excellent deep dive into JavaScript language fundamentals and programming concepts.
Provides strong foundation for understanding how JavaScript works under the hood.Comprehensive exploration of JavaScript's deeper mechanics, scoping, closures,
and advanced language features that many developers never fully understand.DevOps & Infrastructure LearningLearning modern DevOps practices, containerization, cloud platforms, and
infrastructure as code to build and deploy robust applications.Docker containers, Docker Compose, multi-stage builds, and container orchestration
for development and production environments.Created standardized Docker development environments for multiple technology stacks,
enabling consistent development experience across team members.Experience with AWS, Google Cloud, and Cloudflare for hosting, deployment,
and serverless applications.Comprehensive comparison of serverless vs traditional hosting approaches,
including cost analysis, performance characteristics, and use case suitability.GitHub Actions, automated testing, deployment pipelines, and release management
for reliable software delivery.Successfully implemented automated deployment pipelines that enable frequent,
reliable releases with zero downtime.Comprehensive guide to DevOps principles, practices, and cultural transformation
needed to implement effective DevOps in organizations.Game Development KnowledgeAccumulated knowledge from years of game development, from simple 2D games
to complex multiplayer systems and game server architecture.GameMaker Language (GML), game design patterns, sprite management, physics,
and publishing games to multiple platforms.Published games that achieved over 50,000 combined plays across platforms,
demonstrating ability to create engaging player experiences.Java-based game servers, network synchronization, player state management,
and real-time multiplayer systems.In-depth study of different multiplayer game architectures, latency compensation
techniques, and anti-cheat systems for competitive games.Player psychology, game balance, progression systems, and creating engaging
gameplay experiences.Game design principles like user feedback loops, progressive disclosure, and
reward systems apply directly to application UX design and user engagement.Comprehensive exploration of game design principles that apply to both games
and interactive applications. Excellent framework for thinking about user experience.Technical deep dive into the challenges and solutions for building multiplayer
games, including network architecture and synchronization strategies.Database & Data ManagementLearning different database technologies, data modeling, and data management
strategies for various application requirements.PostgreSQL, MySQL, database design, query optimization, and relational data modeling.Collection of real-world database performance problems and their solutions,
including query optimization, indexing strategies, and schema improvements.Drizzle ORM, Prisma, and various query builders for type-safe database operations
and schema management.Comprehensive comparison of different ORM solutions, evaluating type safety,
performance, migration capabilities, and developer experience.MongoDB, Redis, and other NoSQL solutions for specific use cases where
relational databases aren't the optimal choice.Deep dive into the principles and trade-offs involved in designing systems
that handle large amounts of data reliably and efficiently.Soft Skills & Career DevelopmentContinuous development of soft skills, leadership abilities, and professional
competencies that complement technical expertise.Code review, mentoring junior developers, architectural decision-making,
and leading technical discussions.Mentored multiple junior developers who successfully advanced to mid-level
positions with improved technical skills and confidence.Writing clear documentation, giving technical presentations, and explaining
complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.Collection of technical blog posts, documentation, and tutorials that
demonstrate ability to communicate complex concepts clearly.Agile methodologies, sprint planning, stakeholder communication, and
balancing technical debt with feature development.Study of different agile methodologies, their strengths and weaknesses,
and how to adapt them for different team sizes and project types.Systematic approach to debugging, root cause analysis, and breaking down
complex problems into manageable components.The best debuggers aren't those who fix problems fastest, but those who
understand systems well enough to prevent problems from occurring.Essential principles for becoming a more effective programmer, covering
everything from code organization to career development.Guide to advancing beyond individual contributor roles and taking on
technical leadership responsibilities in engineering organizations.Learning Methodology & ResourcesStudy of how to learn effectively as a developer, including different learning
styles, retention strategies, and staying current with rapidly evolving technology.The most effective way to learn programming concepts is through hands-on
building of real projects. Theoretical knowledge without practical application
quickly fades, while concepts learned through building persist.Writing about what you learn - whether in blog posts, documentation, or
personal notes - significantly improves retention and understanding.
Teaching others is one of the best ways to learn.Regularly revisiting concepts and technologies prevents knowledge decay.
Maintaining a learning journal helps identify areas that need reinforcement.Participating in developer communities, forums, and open source projects
provides exposure to different perspectives and approaches to problem-solving.Maintained a regular learning schedule for over 3 years, dedicating time
weekly to exploring new technologies and deepening existing knowledge.Resource RecommendationsCarefully selected resources that have proven valuable in my learning journey,
organized by category and skill level for easy reference.Excellent preparation for system design interviews and understanding
how large-scale systems are architected and scaled.Essential techniques for improving code quality and maintainability
through systematic refactoring approaches.Deep dive into how databases work internally, from storage engines
to distributed systems concepts.Different platforms excel at different types of learning:Practical projects: Build something realTheoretical concepts: University courses and textbooksCurrent trends: Tech blogs and conference talksCommunity knowledge: Stack Overflow and RedditCarefully curated list of developer newsletters that provide high-quality
information without overwhelming noise. Quality over quantity is essential

to expand application delivery capabilitiesFocus on fundamentals that transfer across technologies rather than chasing
